C++ Language Course

☞ C++ is a powerful and widely used programming language primarily designed for system programming, embedded programming, and application development. It's an extension of the C programming language with added features such as classes and objects, which support object-oriented programming (OOP) paradigm. Here's some key information about C++:

  • Object-Oriented Programming (OOP): C++ supports the principles of OOP, including encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism. Classes and objects are fundamental concepts in C++ that allow for modular and reusable code.
  • Standard Template Library (STL): C++ includes a rich set of libraries known as the Standard Template Library (STL), which provides classes and functions for various data structures (like vectors, lists, and maps) and algorithms (like sorting and searching). The STL promotes code reuse and efficiency.
  • Strongly Typed Language: C++ is a statically typed language, meaning variables must be declared with their data types before they can be used. This helps catch errors at compile time and improves performance.

    C language is considered as the mother language of all the modern programming languages because most of the compilers, JVMs, Kernels, etc. are written in C language, and most of the programming languages follow C syntax, for example, C++, Java, C#, etc.
